Of course, I'd be happy to recommend some movies based on your preferences! If you're interested in a classic tale of time travel and social commentary, then "The Time Machine" (1895) is an excellent choice. Starring Rod Taylor as the protagonist, this film takes us on a journey through time to a future where humans have evolved into two separate species, one living on the surface and the other underground. The movie explores themes of inequality and the consequences of human actions on the environment, making it a thought-provoking and entertaining watch.

On the other hand, if you're in the mood for something more lighthearted and comedic, then "Over the Hedge" (2006) is a great option. This animated film features an all-star voice cast, including William Shatner, Wanda Sykes, Garry Shandling, Steve Carell, and Bruce Willis, among others. The movie follows the adventures of a scheming raccoon named RJ who convinces a mismatched family of forest creatures to help him repay a debt of food by invading the new suburban sprawl that popped up while they were hibernating. With plenty of humor and heart, "Over the Hedge" is a fun and entertaining film for all ages.
